Tucson follows Rodimus and to be sure he could be heard, he roars to his Ma=
ximal comrades, in a tone of voice that clearly signals them that he was st=
ill very much alive .  He then looks down to Rodimus and gets beside him.

=
" For once, I agree with you.  We may not always see eye to eye but it does=
n't mean I don't respect who you are.  Now, our only hope to escape this th=
reat is to relocate all together.  We must return to the Ark and see if we =
can get it flying just enough to relocate its position.  Before I became a =
warrior, I did extensive work in mechanical and weaponry restoration.  I ha=
ven't lost sight of those skills. I can attempt to restore the essential co=
mponents for transport, and worry about the rest at a later time.  Of cours=
e I will need a bit of help from anyone with engineering as their backgroun=
d, which I believe Stanton and Bump, along with Legacy, could be a big help=
.  All right, let's guide them home!"

He quickens his pace with a beat of =
his large wings.

Local artist who specializes in illustration, using tradi=
tional and digital media.  

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great =
for any occasion!  

Need a great gift idea that is original?  No problem! =
 Email me at this address and we will talk.

ick up anything useful.  I'm only getting limited scanning
>> range.  We sh=
ould probably send out a general retreat order and assume any
>> stragglers=
 will rejoin us soon and we can lick our wounds."
>> 
>> There was a shake =
of his head, "And we can compare stories back at base."
>>

ight pain, VICE GRIP transforming, "Where is CRYOTEK anyways..
>> He hasn't=
 put in an appearance in quite a few cycles after we went

ther of the FUZORS looked at DINOBOT, =E2=80=9CI saw Cryotek

tack Optimus . . Nemesis . . .  what ever he wanted to

I haven=E2=80=99t seen him  since.=E2=80=9D

ADOW as he looked at DINOBOT and then at the
> others. "Predacons Retreat!!=
!" SKYSHADOW sent across the radio along

ack to base!"

> SKY SHADOW and the FUZORS shifted to beast mode and bega=
n to move off
> into the darkening day, fiery contrails of soot and ash str=
eaking
> across the skies as a wave of magma set the trees and vegatation
>=
 ablaze!

>> <OLD>
>> 
>> Tucson hears his voice and immediately realizes=
 that the bird is actually
>> Rodimus.  He widens his eyes and dives toward=
 him, flying over his leader
>> with out stretched wings, acting like a shi=
eld to protect him and
>> Nightlight.  He looks down.
>> 
>> " Sorry, sligh=
t miscalculation, won't happen again.  I thought the clouds
>> held water b=
ut they don't .  If I knew there was water I could stop the ash
>> and fire=
.  I must try to climb higher, beyond the smoke cover.  But first
>> your s=
aftey is most imperative.  Get into my talons, you will be safe in
>> there=
 under my draconic armor."
>> 
>> He opens his talons to receive his comrad=
es.  Ash rains down on his wings
>> and back yet he ignores the sting and b=
urn of their impact.

> <NEW>
> 
> As TUSCON tried to fly over and protec=
t RODIMUS it is quickly evident
> that RODIMUS was much larger than he had =
been before! He was no
> ordinary sparrow or hawk but he was a giant phoeni=
x with flamed
> slowing off of his wings and entire frame like a bonfire. O=
nly his
> claws where he held the smaller form of NIGHTLIGHT was cool and d=
ark.
> Also the soot and debris that were falling seemed to be doing little=

> to RODIMUS as they quickly turned to ash and char when his flames hit
> =
them.
> 
> They both were flying above and yet away from the Volcano.
> 
> =
=E2=80=9CI do not think a simple rain will stop this volcano.=E2=80=9D RODI=
MUS said
> his voice somehow wiser and deeper than it had been before. =E2=
=80=9CIt is
> purging itself of a dark menace.=E2=80=9D
> 
> Even as RODIMU=
S spoke dark magma began to flow from the mountain.
> 
> =E2=80=9CCome, we =
must get the rest of the Maximals to safety.=E2=80=9D RODIMUS flew
> toward=
s the others as the skies continued to darken and the ground
> began to tur=
n black as it rained ash and fire. "We can do nothing but
> try to heal and=
 get everyone away from here."
> 
> With the ash falling and small burning =
bits of fire and brimstone,
> plus the Magma flows this area will be danger=
ous until the volcano
> fueled storm abates. Smoke was begining to rise fro=
m the ground as
> burning trees fell and burned.
> 
> OOC: To anyone using =
sensors or communications it is possible but

to have at least some of the properties of

d the distortion field that was up

k, but distance is shorter. It's
